children.text: All of the cut bricks within the walls appear to have been broken with a hammer or the like instead of being properly cut with a saw and now have chipped and shattered edges to them.
The relevant Australian Standard AS 3700 Masonry Structures, clause 12.4 Workmanship, states that
‘the cutting of units shall be avoided as far as possible by setting out to avoid irregular or broken bond, particularly adjacent to openings and in piers’
‘Where cutting is necessary units shall be cut so that there is no shattering of the units’.
All of the bricks with chipped and shattered edges should be replaced in accordance with above.
